getMapping() - Method in class org.settings4j.settings.DefaultSettings
The key mapping defined in settings4j.xml: Example: <mapping name="defaultMapping"> <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/> <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleY/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/> </mapping> Settings.getXXX("com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource");
should return the configured value under "global/datasource"

setHibernateConfigXmlKeys(String) - Method in class org.settings4j.connector.db.HibernateDBConnector
You can set a customized hibernateConfigXml Key in your settings4j.xml
Default: "hibernate.cfg.xml"
You can set more than one File with the ',' Seperator
e.g.: "hibernate1.cfg.xml,hibernate2.cfg.xml"

The files will be readed by the given ContentResolvers.
setHibernateMappingXmlKeys(String) - Method in class org.settings4j.connector.db.HibernateDBConnector
You can set a customized HibernateMappingXml in your settings4j.xml
Default: "org/settings4j/connector/db/SettingsDTO.hbm.xml"

The files will be readed by the given ContentResolvers.

SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE - Static variable in interface org.settings4j.Constants
Return value for:
ContentResolver.setContent(String, byte[])
ObjectResolver.setObject(String, ContentResolver, Object)
Connector.setString(String, String)
Connector.setContent(String, byte[])
Connector.setObject(String, Object)

If Settings is not possible (e.g.: ReadOnlyConnectorWrapper or ClasspathConnector )
SETTING_SUCCESS - Static variable in interface org.settings4j.Constants
Return value for:
ContentResolver.setContent(String, byte[])
ObjectResolver.setObject(String, ContentResolver, Object)
Connector.setString(String, String)
Connector.setContent(String, byte[])
Connector.setObject(String, Object)

if Setting was successful: The value for the given key was replaced.
